Class Question

java.lang.Object
com.jeopardy.model.Question
public class Question extends Object
Represents a multiple-choice question in the Jeopardy game.

Each question belongs to a category, has a point value, text, four options (A–D), and one correct answer. Questions can also be marked as answered to prevent reuse.

  • Constructor Details

    • Question

      public Question(String category, int value, String questionText, Map<String,String> options, String correctAnswer)
      Creates a question with the specified parameters.

      A defensive copy of the options map is stored, and the correct answer key is normalized to upper case. Validation is performed to ensure:

      • value > 0
      • options contain A, B, C and D
      • correctAnswer is one of A, B, C or D
      Parameters:
      category - the category name this question belongs to
      value - the point value of the question (must be positive)
      questionText - the question text
      options - map of option key (A–D) to option text
      correctAnswer - the correct option key (A, B, C or D)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any validation rule is violated

  • Method Details

      public String getCategory()
      Returns the category name this question belongs to.
      Returns:
      the category name

      public int getValue()
      Returns the point value of this question.

      public String getQuestionText()
      Returns the question text.
      Returns:
      the question text

    • getOptions

      public Map<String,String> getOptions()
      Returns a defensive copy of the options map.

      Modifying the returned map will not affect the internal state of this question.

      Returns:
      a new map containing all options for this question

    • getCorrectAnswer

      public String getCorrectAnswer()
      Returns the correct answer key (A, B, C or D).
      Returns:
      the correct answer option key

    • isAnswered

      public boolean isAnswered()
      Indicates whether this question has already been answered.
      Returns:
      true if the question has been answered, false otherwise

    • setAnswered

      public void setAnswered(boolean answered)
      Sets the answered state of this question.
      Parameters:
      answered - true if the question has been answered; false otherwise

    • isCorrect

      public boolean isCorrect(String userAnswer)
      Checks whether the given user answer matches the correct answer.

      Comparison is case-insensitive and ignores leading/trailing whitespace.

      Parameters:
      userAnswer - the answer provided by the user (option key or text)
      Returns:
      true if the answer is correct, false otherwise

    • getCorrectAnswerText

      public String getCorrectAnswerText()
      Returns the full text of the correct answer option.
      Returns:
      the text corresponding to the correct answer key, or null if the option is not present

    • getOption

      public String getOption(String choice)
      Returns the option text associated with the given choice key.

      The choice is treated in a case-insensitive manner (e.g. "a" and "A" are equivalent).

      Parameters:
      choice - the option key (A–D)
      Returns:
      the corresponding option text, or null if not present

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this question, including its category, value, question text and answered state.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string describing this question
